comments.content: What happened to asking? And saying please? Are you in the military or what? :^/

Yves\> Pretty #@%\*ing please? :OP

Hi Bob:

This is Neue Helvetica Light Extended  
 [http://www.linotype.com/13113/neuehelvetica43lightextended-font.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202184857/http:/www.linotype.com/13113/neuehelvetica43lightextended-font.html "http://www.linotype.com/13113/neuehelvetica43lightextended-font.html")

I do recommend that if you decide to purchase this font, do so at Fonts.com. Linotype is in Germany and you get an international charge from your bank.

[http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=436479](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202184857/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=436479 "http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=436479")

Also Helvetica comes in many different formats- so choose the one that best fits your budget and requirements.

Mike Diaz :-)
Thank you Mike. I have 45 Light (not Extended) and that what I was using for the i.
